newsitem.title: UK: UK's Oftel studying BT/MCI merger.
newsitem.headline: UK's Oftel studying BT/MCI merger.

text.p: Britain's telecoms industry watchdog Oftel said on Monday it was studying the detail of a proposed merger between British Telecommunications and MCI Communications Corp but that it was too early to pass judgement on the deal.
"We are continuing to study the detail of the deal along with BT, the DTI and others and as soon as we have something to say we will do so," said an Oftel spokesman.
Oftel director general Don Cruickshank will want to satisfy himself how the merger will affect domestic telephone users.
But as a transatlantic merger, like the alliance between British Airways and American Airlines, a decision from Britain ultimately rests with the Department of Trade and Industry.
Britain's secretary of state for trade and industry decides whether to block the deal by referring it to the Monopolies and Mergers Commission for a full inquiry.
UK competition rules are policed by the DTI, the Office of Fair Trading and the Monopolies and Mergers Commission.

Under UK provisions if a merger or acquisition results in a company gaining 25 percent or more of a particular market or the assets of the company being taken over amount to more than 70 million stg, then it has to be investigated by the OFT.
"It's too early to say whether we will be involved or not," said an OFT spokesman.
The merger also requires approval from the U.S. Federal Communications Commission which must approve every deal involving more than 25 percent foreign ownership of a domestic company.
